newsitem.title: USA: First Union Real Estate says to offer shrs.
newsitem.headline: First Union Real Estate says to offer shrs.

text.p: First Union Real Estate Investments said on Thursday it will make a public offering of 5,000,000 of its common shares to go toward the acquisition of parking facilities, repayment of debt and general purposes of the trust.

First Union also said it had granted the underwriters of the offering, Prudential Securities Inc, Alex. Brown & Sons Inc and Sutro & Co Inc, the option to purchase an additional 750,000 shares to cover over-allotments.
The offering will be made pursuant to an effective $200 million shelf registration statement filed by the company in February last year, First Union said in a statement.
Following the offering, First Union said it will have 34.2 million common shares outstanding.
It added that the underwriters expect to price the offering the week of May 19.

"With these funds, we will be able to move ahead rapidly to implement our strategy of becoming the leading company in the parking industry in North America," said First Union chief executive James Mastandrea.
First Union Real Estate Investments is a real estate investment trust.
